ðŸ’¡ Step 2: Set S.M.A.R.T. Financial Goals - When setting your financial goals make sure they are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic, and Timely (S.M.A.R.T.). Whether it is saving for a holiday, buying a house or retiring comfortably, clear goals will help guide your financial decisions.

ðŸ’¡ Step 3: Develop a Budget - It's crucial to know where your money is going so you can direct it where you want it to be. Make a budget that reflects your earnings, costs and also includes your financial goals. Remember, a little can go a long way in saving!

ðŸ’¡ Step 4: Pay Off Your Debts - Concentrate on reducing any outstanding debts you have, particularly high interest ones. Paying these off as soon as possible will free up more of your income for savings and investments.

ðŸ’¡ Step 5: When you are debt free, focus on Building Your Emergency Fund - Life is unpredictable and having a safety net can help you cope with financial surprises without going into debt. Aim to save 3-6 months' worth of living expenses.
